alert.note: Alert for Hawaii in Hawaii (Hawaii) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued February 18 at 5:14PM HST until February 18 at 7:00PM HST by NWS Honolulu
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM HST THIS EVENING FOR THE ISLAND OF HAWAII IN HAWAII COUNTY... At 514 PM HST, radar and rain gages indicated that rainfall rates have eased over the southeast flank of the Big Island. However, runoff levels were still high, and the Hawaii County Civil Defense Agency reported that Highway 11 at Kawa Flats, Wood Valley Road, and Kaalaiki Road were still closed in the Kau District. These roads will likely remain closed tonight. HAZARD...Heavy rain producing life threatening flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Significant and life threatening flooding in drainages, streams, rivers, roads, properties, and other low lying areas. Multiple roads have been closed. Landslides are expected in steep terrain. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Hilo, Hawaiian Paradise Park, Volcano, Glenwood, Hawaii Volcanoes National Park, Mountain View, Wood Valley, Hawaiian Acres, Keaau, Orchidland Estates, Pahala, Papaikou, Pepeekeo, Pahoa, Punaluu Beach and Honomu. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Routes such as Wood Valley Road and Kaalaiki Road have many low water crossings that are flooded. Do not cross fast flowing or rising water in your vehicle, or on foot. Turn around, don`t drown. Stay away from streams, rivers, drainage ditches, and culverts.
